Once upon a time, in a small town, there was a lively train. The train loved to talk to everyone. It would say "hello" and "goodbye" to all the people who came to ride on it. The train was very happy when it could talk to its friends.
One day, a little boy named Tim came to the train station with his mom. They wanted to ride the lively train to visit Tim's grandma. When the train saw them,

day, the parrot spotted the same man walking down the street again. He flew over, determined to make friends this time. He was surprised to see the man pick up a rock and throw it at him.
The rock hit the parrot and he fell to the ground. He didn't move. The man turned and walked away, not recognizing what he had just done.
The parrot never flew again. He lay on the path, lifeless, with no one to recognize him.

Ella returned to the park and noticed something strange. The sun was shining brightly and the air felt warm. Ella was so happy and suddenly, she understood why the park was closed the day before.
A big storm was coming and the law closed the park to keep the people safe. Ella felt relieved and so happy that the law kept people warm and safe.

Once upon a time, there was a shy cat named Tim. Tim lived on a street with many other animals. He liked to play with his friends, but sometimes he felt scared.
One day, Tim saw a big dog. The dog barked loudly, and Tim began to tremble. He didn't know what to do, so he hid behind a tree. His friend, a little bird named Sue, saw him shaking.
Sue asked, "Tim, why are you shaking?" Tim replied, "I am scared of

take a look. It was a friendly fox! The fox was very young and wanted to join Lily in her fun.
So they started to rush around together. They ran past the flowers and chased each other around the playground. They had so much fun!
Lily and the fox ran until they were so tired they could not run anymore. They stopped, said goodbye and went on their way. Lily smiled, feeling happy and content.

the other birds noticed how ugly the singing bird was. They started making fun of it. The bird felt so sad, it stopped singing and flew away. 
But, deep down, the bird knew that it had cheered up all the birds with its beautiful singing, even if they were unkind. It smiled to itself, happy that it had been able to make others happy even though it was ugly.

One day, a little girl named Amy went for a walk with her mom. They saw many fun things, like dogs, cats, and big trees. Amy was very happy to be outside with her mom.

. But then, Jack heard something creepy. It sounded like a monster right behind him. Jack was frightened and started to run back home. 
By the time he got to his house, Jack was out of breath. His mom saw what happened and sat him down. She told him there are many things in life that can be scary. It's ok to be alert and prepared, but it's not good to pretend that life is always a scary adventure. 
Jack understood and promised to think twice before pretending to be a superhero. He also promised his mom to always listen to his inner voice for advice and guidance.

looked around at the trees and spotted a mouse. Pete gasped and stepped away. Jimmy, Pete's friend, saw him and ran over.
Jimmy: "What's wrong Pete?"
Pete: "I saw a mouse!"
Jimmy: "Oh don't be fearful, Pete. Come and have some cheese with me."
Pete: "OK!"
Jimmy and Pete sat down on the grass and shared some cheese. They laughed and talked until dusk. Afterwards, Pete felt much better and his fear had gone.

Once upon a time there were two best friends, Emma and Alex. They were very

were playing in the garden when a large arm appeared from the clouds. The arm reached down from the sky and gave them a big surprise. The brothers were amazed and thanked the arm for the wonderful surprise. 
One brother asked, "What do we do with it?"
The arm replied, "You must share it together."
The brothers smiled and thanked the arm again. They shared the surprise together and had lots of fun. They were so happy that they thanked the arm every day for the wonderful surprise.

Once upon a time, there was a thin little tree. The tree had big dreams of growing tall

in the grass.
The grandchild's eyes grew wide in amazement. "What is it?" he asked.
"It's a teaspoon," said Grandma, beaming.
The grandchild examined it carefully. He picked it up and tried to skip with it in his hand.
"Be careful, child," said Grandma. "It's a serious thing."
The grandchild nodded solemnly. Then he carefully put it back in the grass and went on skipping happily around the park.

Once there was a boy named Jack who liked ponies. He dreamed of having a pony of his own, but he knew his family couldn't afford to buy one.
One day, Jack went to the market with his family, and he saw

her hand.
Sarah was so excited that she wanted to talk to the fairy. But the fairy had a very serious look on her face and Sarah knew she must have been busy. So Sarah quietly walked over to her and waited patiently. 
Finally, the fairy noticed Sarah and asked her why she was there. Sarah smiled and said that she just wanted to know if the fairy was okay. The fairy smiled back and said she was happy to have Sarah watching over her. 
Sarah and the fairy talked for a while and became good friends. They still meet up in the garden every day to have fun and play.

Once upon a time, there was a brave king and he loved to talk. Everywhere he went, he talked about being brave and courageous. One day, the king went on a dangerous adventure.
Many people were scared and did not want him to go. But the King was brave and he wanted to prove his bravery. He carried a sword and a shield and set out on the journey.

Tim's mom told him he needed to quit playing and take a nap. He was very tired, but

dance. The musicians noticed her and stopped playing. 
"Do you want to join us?" said the lead singer of the Jazz band. "Okay," she said with a smile. 
The band started playing again, and Jill began to lift her arms and dance along to the music. 
The musicians were so impressed at how well she moved that they offered her a regular spot in their band. 
Jill was so happy that she couldn't stop smiling. Since then she's become a regular part of their band, and every day she lifts her arms and dances along to the jazz music.

day was so great. Then Jack found something very special. He found a zip! He ran to his mum and said "Look Mum! Look what I found!" His Mum smiled and said "Well done Jack! Let's try and fix the zip, maybe you can put it on something and make it special."
So Jack and his mum tried to fix the zip but, sadly, it wouldn't turn. They couldn't make it work. Jack was very sad and said "I wanted to make something special with the zip". His Mum gave him a hug and said "We can try again, don't worry". But then suddenly

owner of the club and he was very angry. He shouted: "That club is mine!"
Tom was scared and started to cry. He didn't know what to do. But then he heard a gentle voice from behind. It was a wise old lady.
She said: "Tom, don't be scared. You shouldn't take what doesn't belong to you. You should respect other people's belongings and treat them with care." 
Tom learned something valuable that day. He understood that even though he was curious and wanted to find out more about the club, it was not his to take. Even if something looks interesting

elephant took a marker out of his pocket. He drew a big star on the oat, so they could find it easily.
The two friends then went their separate ways, but the mouse kept thinking about the oat. When he went back to the river to look for it, it was nowhere to be seen. 
He asked the other animals if they had seen it, but nobody had. The mouse was disappointed and a little sad, so he decided to go back home.
On his way home, he saw the elephant again. “Did you take the oat?” he asked the elephant.

Once there was a boy who was always complaining. Everywhere he went he was sure to find something to complain about. One day, he was walking down the street when he came across a huge puddle. But this was no ordinary puddle -- it was filthy with mud and yucky stuff.
The boy started to complain about the puddle. He said things like, "It's so icky and gross!" and, "It's ruining my shoes!" He even tried to jump over it, but he ended up splashing it all over himself.
The boy then looked around and saw that no one else was

little boy gazed out his bedroom window.
The boy saw something big, grey and wide eyed. It was an owl, perched on top of the tree in his backyard.
The little boy was curious. He knew the owl must have something interesting to say. He decided to go outside and find out.
As soon as he stepped onto the grass, the owl let out a loud hoot. 
The little boy's eyes lit up. He said, "Hello!"
The owl didn't answer.
The little boy said, "Please talk to me!" 
Again, the owl kept still and quiet.
